paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision ../../structure/project.xmlProjects managed files, as described in vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects 0 Item Management in Projects . EiffelEnvision also manages linked project items, via the ../../structure/other_project_items/other_project_items.xmlOther Project Items hierarchy, but only to support referencing existing items related to the project.

Adding new project items to an EiffelEnvision project is context-sensitive. Because EiffelEnvision ../../structure/project.xmlProjects manage direct links to files, adding a file to a folder (../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlcluster) or the ../../structure/project.xmlproject node will cause the file to be created in that folder's ../project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath. Supporting this, when adding new items to a project, no Location for the new item can be specified in the vxurfAddNewItemDialogBox 0 Add New Item dialog box.

There are numerous ways to add new project item to your project. First select the folder where you would like the new project item to be created. If you select the ../../structure/project.xmlProject Node, EiffelEnvision will do exactly the same as if you were to add new item via the ../../structure/project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items Folder. This is because the ../../structure/project.xmlProject and ../../structure/project_items/project_items.xmlProject Item folders have the same ../project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath. After selecting the appropriate folder, either use the Project, Add New Item... (CTRL+SHIFT+A) or use the Add, Add New Item... context menu. Once selected the vxurfAddNewItemDialogBox 0 Add New Item dialog box will appear.
Note: UI and Code project_items.xmlNew Project Item Templates can be added to all folders in EiffelEnvision ../../structure/project.xmlProjects, with the exception to the ../../structure/other_project_items/other_project_items.xmlOther Project Files folder. Data and Resource items may only be added to the ../../structure/project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items folder and any of it subfolders/subclusters. This is further maintain the separation between project-specific items and ../../structure/eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xmlEiffel Libraries.

The vxurfAddNewItemDialogBox 0 Add New Item dialog box provides a default Name for the new item, which you may change to any valid file name. If you accidentally enter an invalid file name, you will be prompted with an error message. You will not be able to proceed unless the Name field contains a valid file name.

New project item names should also not conflict with any file name or folder presently at the associated folder (which the file will be added to.) The file name should be unique as not to overwrite or conflict with any other file, folder or ../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folders at the chosen folder ../project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath.
On inspecting the Project menu or the Add context menu, there are a number of special "shortcut" new items.

The following table shows a list, as laid out in the menu, of the shortcut new items.

Add Windows Form... Adds a form for Windows applications to your project.

Add Class... Adds an empty class declaration.
